text: Under the Iron Sea is the second album by rock band Keane. It was launched in June 2006. There is a version with a bonus DVD. This includes videos and demo versions of songs. The title of the album comes from the phrase "I lost my heart. I buried it too deep under the iron sea," of the eighth (8th) song, "Crystal Ball". In its first week sold 222,297 copies. It was #1 in UK and #4 in US. The album had sold 1,000,000 copies to date. == Song list == * All tracks written by Tim Rice-Oxley, Tom Chaplin, and Richard Hughes. # "Atlantic" (4:13) # "Is It Any Wonder?" (3:08) # "Nothing In My Way" (4:02) # "Leaving So Soon?" (3:58) # "A Bad Dream" (5:04) # "Hamburg Song" (4:37) # "Put It Behind You" (3:35) # "The Iron Sea" (2:57) # "Crystal Ball" (3:53) # "Try Again" (4:26) # "Broken Toy" (6:07) # "The Frog Prince" (4:21) Note: Some editions combine "The Iron Sea" with "Put It Behind You," with a length of 6:33. == Charts == UK Album Chart Week 1 2 3 4 Position 1 1 2 4 Irish Album Chart Week 1 2 3 Position 1 3 6 Billboard 200 Week 1 2 3 Position 4 20 31 Sales 75,702 36,374 22,666 Total 75,702 112,076 134,742 Canadian Album Chart Week 01 Position 7 Global Chart Week 1 2 3 Position 2 2 4 Sales 335,000 261,000 176,000 Total 335,000 596,000 772,000 == General charts == * United Kingdom: #1 * United States: #4 * Canada: #7 * Ireland: #1 * Switzerland: #2 * Holland: #1 * Germany: #3 * Portugal: #3 * Norway: #3 * Mexico: #3 * Denmark: #5 * 'India': #8 ==Related pages== * List of songs by Keane == Other websites == * Official Site * Austrian Fansite * Fansite * French Fansite * Link to download a UTIS fan-made font Category:2006 albums Category:Keane (band) Category:Island Records albums Category:Rock albums
title: Under the Iron Sea
